page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area lies to the west of Bridgwater. Houses to north of Coker hurst farm were built in the 1930s. Quantock Rd was constructed in late 1920s to replace dangerous route through Wembdon (sharp bends,poor junction.) Houses to north east of the reservoir were built in the 60s & 70s and Bridgwater expanded beyond its administrative boundaries. There are 418 semi-detached 92 detached & 317 bungalows,mainly with attached garages (approx.) At Qeenswood farm is illegal warehouse business.Council taking action against owner because of likely traffic nuisance to neighbours. Most of area agricultural, lying between 15 & 80 metres above sea level highest point 82m. Land crossed by 2 rows of transmission lines NWtoSE & W to SE. Approx 4 to 5% water cover in ponds,streams and reservoir.
